intro: Trichelostylis salbundia, commonly known as the slender spike orchid, is a species of orchid native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in spikes. The plant typically grows in forested areas, often in shaded, moist environments. It has a fibrous root system and produces a single, narrow leaf per stem. Trichelostylis salbundia is a relatively rare and endemic species, making it of interest to botanists and conservationists.
